timeline.bodyText: What is the original value? The monitoring can be smaller so that when the lease expires, the other waiters can get hold of the lease quickly.
timeline.author: xiaoqin2012

replies.bodyText: The original lease value is 60seconds, to 10 maybe?
replies.author: annym

timeline.bodyText: Can we make the monitor fraction bigger such as 10 or 20, so that the lease acquire/release can happen with smaller delay?
timeline.author: xiaoqin2012
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -52,6 +54,16 @@
      */
     private static final int FETCH_THRESHOLD = 300;
 
+    /**
+     * Fraction of Lease Duration for Lease Renewal
+     */
+    private static final int RENEWAL_LEASE_FRACTION = 4;
+
+    /**
+     * Fraction of Lease Duration for Lease Monitoring
+     */
+    private static final int MONITOR_LEASE_FRACTION = 2;
+

timeline.bodyText: is it better to rename to lockClient?
timeline.author: pankti-m

timeline.bodyText: Will it cleaner to call lock.shutdown in the server shutdown call?
timeline.author: xiaoqin2012

replies.bodyText: That would mean exposing it. And the lock is really created by the Discovery Service, I think keeping it to the DiscoveryService scope is fine.
replies.author: annym

timeline.bodyText: When will this callback be called? Which component detects the connection down?
timeline.author: xiaoqin2012

replies.bodyText: The Transport Plugin is the one detecting connections coming up or down.
replies.author: annym

replies.bodyText: I am just wondering what happen to the snapshot sender/log entry sender  when there is a connection loss and what happen to the fsm state machine.
replies.author: xiaoqin2012

replies.bodyText: Currently, what happens is that if connection is lost to the remote leader we move to verify remote leader state (if any other connection is still up) or to wait for connections (if no connection is available). But we don't do anything to the snapshot/log entry senders. So good point, this is something we should add. I'm adding that we stop log replication, can you help confirm if that does the correct configuration of the snapshot/log entry sender? or if something else is needed...
replies.author: annym

replies.bodyText:
I saw that the sender catch all exceptions and called cancel.  There are two options:

the sender identify the exception type and generate stop event instead of cancel.
when the replication state machine detects the current leader connection loss, put a stop event for FSM.
replies.author: xiaoqin2012

replies.bodyText: We can do in another PR ...
replies.author: xiaoqin2012

replies.bodyText: We need to add try and catch for processReads to catch the exceptions.
replies.author: xiaoqin2012

timeline.message:
Standby Connection Loss Fix

1. Fix Issue when Standby connection is lost
2. Fix replication server graceful shutdown
3. Add logging
4. Adjust default and configurable lock values: monitor, renewal, lease duration and lease check

timeline.bodyText: ..fraction of lease duration after which lease renewal thread will run?

+    /**

timeline.bodyText: does it need to be concurrent?
timeline.author: pankti-m

replies.bodyText: I removed that as all the methods that modify or access this object are synchronized.
replies.author: annym

timeline.bodyText: Can you add a comment saying what these tests do?
